Package io.dapr.client.domain

Class JobSchedule

java.lang.Object
io.dapr.client.domain.JobSchedule
public class JobSchedule extends Object
Represents a job schedule using cron expressions or fixed intervals. This class provides various static methods to create schedules based on predefined periods (e.g., daily, weekly, monthly) or using custom cron expressions. Example usage: 
 JobsSchedule schedule = JobsSchedule.daily();
 System.out.println(schedule.getExpression()); // Outputs: "0 0 0 * * *"

  • Method Details

    • fromPeriod

      public static JobSchedule fromPeriod(Duration duration)
      Creates a job schedule from a fixed period using a Duration. The resulting expression follows the format: "@every XhYmZsWms" where X, Y, Z, and W represent hours, minutes, seconds, and milliseconds respectively. Example: 
       JobsSchedule schedule = JobsSchedule.fromPeriod(Duration.ofMinutes(30));
 System.out.println(schedule.getExpression()); // Outputs: "@every 0h30m0s0ms"
      Parameters:
      duration - the duration of the period.
      Returns:
      a JobsSchedule with the corresponding interval.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the duration is null.

    • fromString

      public static JobSchedule fromString(String cronExpression)
      Creates a job schedule from a custom cron expression.
      Parameters:
      cronExpression - the cron expression.
      Returns:
      a JobsSchedule representing the given cron expression.
